de.a46.memory.gui
Class ButtonbarPanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--java.awt.Panel
                    |
                    +--de.a46.memory.gui.ButtonbarPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, MPanelListener, java.io.Serializable
public class ButtonbarPanel
extends java.awt.Panel
implements MPanelListener

Class ButtonbarPanel represents the button bar of the memory gui. Its size is fixed 720 x 22 pixel, it is located to the upper border. Interface MPanelListener is implemented, because three MButtons are contained. A ButtonbarListener can be added to get Events, when those buttons are clicked.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke
See Also:
Serialized Form

mpanelClicked

public void mpanelClicked(MPanel source)
This method is called automatically, if one of the three buttons will be clicked. Corresponding methods will of any registered userActionListener will be called. Also this buttonbarPanel will be disabled.
Specified by:
mpanelClicked in interface MPanelListener
Parameters:
e - incoming MPanelEvent, that will be examined by MPanel.getID().

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean b)
Changes the eabled-state of this buttonbarPanel and all subcomponents. That means, rollover and clicks are switched on/off.
Overrides:
setEnabled in class java.awt.Component
Parameters:
